hints.content:
To compare fractions, both wholes must be the same size.

Which image shows $\dfrac36$ and $\dfrac38$ represented on the same size whole?

This image shows $\dfrac{3}{8}$ and $\dfrac{3}{6}$ on the same size wholes. Now it is fair to compare them!

[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: Two triangles of the same size. There is a less than sign between the triangles. The first triangle is divided into eight equal parts. Three parts are shaded. The second triangle is divided into six equal parts. Three parts are shaded. The total shaded area of first triangle covers less space than the shaded area of the second triangle. !

hints.content:
This image best allows us to compare the fractions.

[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: Two triangles of the same size. There is a less than sign between the triangles. The first triangle is divided into eight equal parts. Three parts are shaded. The second triangle is divided into six equal parts. Three parts are shaded. The total shaded area of first triangle covers less space than the shaded area of the second triangle. !

question.content:
**Which picture best helps us compare $\dfrac{3}{8}$ and $\dfrac{3}{6}$?**

[[☃ radio 1]]

choices.clue: The first circle is bigger than the second circle, so it is not fair to compare the fractions.
choices.content: ![Two circles of different sizes. There is a greater than sign between the circles. The first circle is big. It is divided into eight equal parts. Three parts are shaded. The second circle is small. It is divided into six equal parts. Three parts are shaded. The total shaded area of first circle covers more space than the shaded area of the second circle.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/2931af3f0587a881e73fe8b84023f55ce3e347eb)

choices.clue: The first rectangle is bigger than the second rectangle, so it is not fair to compare the fractions.
choices.content: ![Two rectangles of different sizes. There is an equal sign between the rectangles. The first rectangle is divided into 8 equal parts. Three parts are shaded. The second rectangle is smaller than the first rectangle. It is divided into 6 equal parts of the same size as in the first rectangle. 3 parts are shaded. The total shaded area of the first rectangle covers the same amount of space as the shaded area of the second rectangle.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/70ddc237955d9f0ff11ed08711154b51d2704fe0)

choices.clue: The triangles are the same size, so it is fair to compare the area of the fractions.
choices.content: ![Two triangles of the same size. There is a less than sign between the triangles. The first triangle is divided into eight equal parts. Three parts are shaded. The second triangle is divided into six equal parts. Three parts are shaded. The total shaded area of first triangle covers less space than the shaded area of the second triangle.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/d118b38e9fd507f8e74a8f10cc30ccee4356e3fb)
